Detailed Description

Database query class. Instantiated object represents a SQL query that can be executed to retrieve data from a MySQL database.

Author:
Ryan LeFevre
See also:
OsimoDB

Definition at line 205 of file db2.module.php.

$  args,
$  db 
)

Constructor for OsimoDBQuery class. This should strictly be called from the OsimoDB class.

mixed $args Can be Array or String with comma separated values

the current OsimoDBQuery object (allows chainability)

Parameters:

String $on The join condition, aka the ON part of the JOIN clause

Definition at line 418 of file db2.module.php.

where (  ) 

Adds a WHERE clause to a MySQL query. This function takes a variable number of arguments, and works exactly like printf() or scanf().

Returns:
the current OsimoDBQuery object (allows chainability)

Definition at line 449 of file db2.module.php.

limit ( $  start,
$  num = false 
)

Adds a LIMIT clause to a MySQL query.

Parameters:
int $start
mixed $num (optional) If $num isn't false, then the output is: LIMIT $start,$num
Returns:
the current OsimoDBQuery object (allows chainability)

Definition at line 471 of file db2.module.php.

order_by ( $  cols,
$  dir = false 
)

Adds an ORDER BY clause to a MySQL query. Can be of format: order_by(Array("col_name"=>"ASC")); or: order_by("col_name","ASC");

Parameters:
mixed $cols If type is Array, then $dir will be ignored.
String $dir (optional) Can only be ASC or DESC.
Returns:
the current OsimoDBQuery object (allows chainability)

Definition at line 491 of file db2.module.php.

values ( $  args  ) 

Adds a VALUES clause to an INSERT MySQL query.

This function should work similar to the where() function so that data can be automatically escaped.

Parameters:
Array $args
Returns:
the current OsimoDBQuery object (allows chainability)

Definition at line 517 of file db2.module.php.

cell ( $  cache = false,
$  cache_length = 300 
)

Returns a single value/cell from a MySQL table.

Parameters:
boolean $cache (optional) Should this value be cached or not?
int $cache_length (optional) If caching is enabled, how long should it be cached for?
Returns:
String of data returned from the MySQL query.

Definition at line 541 of file db2.module.php.

row ( $  cache = false,
$  cache_length = 300 
)

Returns a single row/tuple from a MySQL table.

Parameters:
boolean $cache (optional) Should this data be cached or not?
int $cache_length (optional) If caching is enabled, how long should it be cached for?
Returns:
One-dimensional array of data returned from the MySQL query.

Definition at line 565 of file db2.module.php.

rows ( $  cache = false,
$  cache_length = 300 
)

Returns multiple rows/tuples from a MySQL table.

Parameters:
boolean $cache (optional) Should this data be cached or not?
int $cache_length (optional) If caching is enabled, how long should it be cached for?
Returns:
Two-dimensional array of data returned from the MySQL query.

Definition at line 594 of file db2.module.php.

insert ( &$  insertID = false  ) 

Executes a MySQL INSERT query and places the last insert ID into the parameter $insertID.

Parameters:
int $insertID (reference) The last insert ID returned by mysql_insert_id();
Returns:
Boolean reflecting the query success.

Definition at line 623 of file db2.module.php.

update (  ) 

Executes a MySQL UPDATE query.

Returns:
Boolean reflecting the query success.

Definition at line 638 of file db2.module.php.

query ( $  run = true,
$  cache = false,
$  cache_length = 300 
)

Executes a generic MySQL query, and also executes the queries for the helper functions above.

Parameters:
boolean $run (optional) Should the function execute the query or simply return the SQL String?
int $cache (optional) Should this data be cached or not?
int $cache_length (optional) If caching is enabled, how long should it be cached for?
Returns:
If $run is true, will return the MySQL result resource, otherwise it will return the SQL query without executing it.

Definition at line 660 of file db2.module.php.

__toString (  ) 

Echoing this class (without executing the query) will output the built SQL query itself.
